title: German Research Foundation - Wikipedia
snippet: Even before the election of the National Socialist German Workers' Party (Nazi party) to power in 1933, projects funded by the NG had worked diligently on Nazi-aligned research, especially German ethnographic research in Eastern Europe that would lay the foundations for the Hitlerite "Lebensraum" and extermination policies; during the National Socialist period, the NG leadership showed itself ready and willing to adapt to the "new era" by gearing its funding practices towards issues related to German rearmament and autarky, essentially aligning its goals with those of the new regime.

snippet: The DFG's Heisenberg Programme is aimed at excellent researchers who meet all the formal requirements for appointment to a permanent professorship. It enables them to further develop their own research profile in a targeted manner and to prepare for an academic leadership position.

title: German Research Foundation // University of Oldenburg
snippet: All universities that are members of the German Research Foundation appoint a professor to act as a DFG Liaison Officer. The Liaison Officers are the local DFG contacts for researchers who are considering applying to the DFG for funding.

title: Germany, German Research Foundation (DFG) - International Science Council
snippet: The DFG funds research projects, creates competitive opportunities and conducts procedures for the review, evaluation, selection and decision of research proposals. It helps shape the overall conditions and standards of academic research. The DFG maintains dialogue with society, politics and business and supports the transfer of knowledge.
